member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.DbCommandExtensions.ExecuteReaderWithRetryAsync(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.EntLib.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Executes the ExecuteReaderAsync method which will automatically retry if the query has failed (or connection was dropped) Repeatedly executes operation while it satisfies the current retry policy, the retry policy is used for transient faults like SQL Azure transient faults or AlwaysOn automatic failover scenarios (Secondary is switching to the Primary).
member.param: The db command.
The transient fault retry policy.
member.returns: The task.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.DbCommandExtensions.ExecuteReaderWithRetryAsync(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.EntLib.RetryPolicy,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes the ExecuteReaderAsync method which will automatically retry if the query has failed (or connection was dropped) Repeatedly executes operation while it satisfies the current retry policy, the retry policy is used for transient faults like SQL Azure transient faults or AlwaysOn automatic failover scenarios (Secondary is switching to the Primary).
member.param: The db command.
The transient fault retry policy.
A cancellation token used to indicate when to cancel the operation.
member.returns: The task.

member.summary: Sends the specified command to the connection and builds a DbDataReader object that contains the results. Uses the specified retry policy when executing the command.
member.param: The command object that is required for the extension method declaration.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry a command if a connection fails while executing the command.
member.returns: A System.Data.Common.DbDataReader object.

member.summary: Executes a Transact-SQL statement against the connection and returns the number of rows affected. Uses the specified retry policy when executing the command.
member.param: The command object that is required for the extension method declaration.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry a command if a connection fails while executing the command.
member.returns: The number of rows affected.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlAlwaysOnErrorDetection.InappropriateReplicaRole
member.summary: Inappropriate replica role

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlAlwaysOnErrorDetection.DatabaseIsNotAccessible
member.summary: The target database is participating in an availability group and is currently not accessible for queries. Either data movement is suspended or the availability replica is not enabled for read access.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlAzureErrorDetection.NotEnoughResources
member.summary: Cannot process request. Not enough resources to process request. The service is currently busy. Please retry the request later.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlAzureErrorDetection.TooManyCreateOrUpdateOperationsInProgressForSubscription
member.summary: Cannot process create or update request. Too many create or update operations in progress for subscription. Requests are currently blocked for resource optimization.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlAzureErrorDetection.TooManyOperationsInProgressForSubscription
member.summary: Cannot process request. Too many operations in progress for subscription. The service is busy processing multiple requests for this subscription. Requests are currently blocked for resource optimization.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlNetworkConnectivityErrorDetection.NetworkConnectivityError
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 11001 A network-related or instance-specific error occurred while establishing a connection to SQL Server. The server was not found or was not accessible. Verify that the instance name is correct and that SQL Server is configured to allow remote connections. (provider: TCP Provider, error: 0 - No such host is known.)

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientError
member.summary: Defines transient error detection predicates that can be chained together to define composite predicates.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientError.DetectAllRecommendedSqlErrors
member.summary: A transient error detection predicate that will detect all known transient errors for all supported SqlServer contexts (i.e. vanilla, AlwaysOn, SqlAzure).
member.returns: A delegate implementing the predicate.

member.returns: A delegate implementing the predicate.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ResourceLimitReached
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 10928 Resource ID: %d. The %s limit for the database is %d and has been reached.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ServerTooBusyForRequestsGreater
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 10929 Resource ID: %d. The %s minimum guarantee is %d, maximum limit is %d and the current usage for the database is %d. However, the server is currently too busy to support requests greater than %d for this database.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.TransportLevelErrorReceivingRequests
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 10053 A transport-level error has occurred when receiving results from the server. An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.TransportLevelErrorSendingRequests
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 10054 A transport-level error has occurred when sending the request to the server. (provider: TCP Provider, error: 0 - An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.)

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.NetworkRelatedErrorEstablishingConnection
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 10060 A network-related or instance-specific error occurred while establishing a connection to SQL Server. The server was not found or was not accessible. Verify that the instance name is correct and that SQL Server is configured to allow remote connections. (provider: TCP Provider, error: 0 - A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond.)"}

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ServerEncountedErrorProcessingRequest
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 40197 The service has encountered an error processing your request. Please try again.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ServiceEncountedErrorProcessingRequest
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 40540 The service has encountered an error processing your request. Please try again.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.DatabaseNotCurrentlyAvailable
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 40613 Database XXXX on server YYYY is not currently available. Please retry the connection later. If the problem persists, contact customer support, and provide them the session tracing ID of ZZZZZ.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ServiceEncounteredAnError
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 40143 The service has encountered an error processing your request. Please try again.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ClientNotAbleToEstablishAConnection
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 233 The client was unable to establish a connection because of an error during connection initialization process before login. Possible causes include the following: the client tried to connect to an unsupported version of SQL Server; the server was too busy to accept new connections; or there was a resource limitation (insufficient memory or maximum allowed connections) on the server. (provider: TCP Provider, error: 0 - An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.) System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException: A connection was successfully established with the server, but then an error occurred during the login process. (provider: Named Pipes Provider, error: 0 - No process is on the other end of the pipe.) It appears that this happens when the database has just been created but has not yet finished opening or is auto-closing when using the AUTO_CLOSE option. The workaround is to flush the pool for the connection and then retry the Open call.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ConnectionEstablishedButErroOccurredDuringLogin
member.summary: SQL Error Code: 64 A connection was successfully established with the server, but then an error occurred during the login process. (provider: TCP Provider, error: 0 - The specified network name is no longer available.)

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ProcessNetLibErrorCode
member.summary: Error codes reported by the DBNETLIB module.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.ConnectionTimeoutExpired
member.summary: System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException: Connection Timeout Expired. The timeout period elapsed while attempting to consume the pre-login handshake acknowledgement. This could be because the pre-login handshake failed or the server was unable to respond back in time.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.WaitOperationTimedOut
member.summary: Transient wait expired error resulting in timeout

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.SemaphoreWaitOperationTimesOut
member.summary: Transient semaphore wait expired error resulting in timeout

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.SnapshotIsolationTransactionAbortedDueToUpdateConflict
member.summary: Snapshot isolation transaction aborted due to update conflict. You cannot use snapshot isolation to access table '%.*ls' directly or indirectly in database '%.*ls' to update, delete, or insert the row that has been modified or deleted by another transaction. Retry the transaction or change the isolation level for the update/delete statement.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.CannotOpenDatabaseLoginFailed
member.summary: Cannot open database requested by the login.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.RemoteHardeningFailure
member.summary: Remote harden of transaction '%.*ls' (ID 0x%016I64x %ls) started at %S_DATE in database '%ls' at LSN %S_LSN failed. Cannot continue the execution because the session is in the kill state. A severe error occurred on the current command.The results, if any, should be discarded.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.SessionInKillState
member.summary: Cannot continue the execution because the session is in the kill state.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlTransientErrorDetection.TransactionWasDeadlockVictim
member.summary: The transaction was deadlocked and chosen as the deadlock victim.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingMode
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling modes in SQL Database.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingMode.NoThrottling
member.summary: Corresponds to the "No Throttling" throttling mode, in which all SQL statements can be processed.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingMode.RejectUpdateInsert
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Reject Update / Insert" throttling mode, in which SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, CREATE TABLE, and CREATE INDEX are rejected.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingMode.RejectAllWrites
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Reject All Writes" throttling mode, in which SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, and DROP are rejected.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingMode.RejectAll
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Reject All" throttling mode, in which all SQL statements are rejected.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingMode.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling mode whereby throttling mode cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingType
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling types in SQL Database.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingType.None
member.summary: Indicates that no throttling was applied to a given resource.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingType.Soft
member.summary: Corresponds to a soft throttling type. Soft throttling is applied when machine resources such as, CPU, I/O, storage, and worker threads exceed predefined safety thresholds despite the load balancerâ€™s best efforts.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingType.Hard
member.summary: Corresponds to a hard throttling type. Hard throttling is applied when the machine is out of resources, for example storage space. With hard throttling, no new connections are allowed to the databases hosted on the machine until resources are freed up.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling type in the event that the throttling type cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType
member.summary: Defines the types of resources in SQL Database that may be subject to throttling conditions.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.PhysicalDatabaseSpace
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Physical Database Space" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.PhysicalLogSpace
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Physical Log File Space" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.LogWriteIoDelay
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Transaction Log Write IO Delay" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.DataReadIoDelay
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Database Read IO Delay" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.Cpu
member.summary: Corresponds to the "CPU" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.DatabaseSize
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Database Size" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.WorkerThreads
member.summary: Corresponds to the "SQL Worker Thread Pool" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.Internal
member.summary: Corresponds to an internal resource that may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottledResourceType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown resource type in the event that the actual resource cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition
member.summary: Implements an object that holds the decoded reason code returned from SQL Database when throttling conditions are encountered.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.ThrottlingErrorNumber
member.summary: Gets the error number that corresponds to the throttling conditions reported by SQL Database.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.throttledResources
member.summary: Maintains a collection of key/value pairs where a key is the resource type and a value is the type of throttling applied to the given resource type.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.sqlErrorCodeRegEx
member.summary: Provides a compiled regular expression used to extract the reason code from the error message.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.Unknown
member.summary: Gets an unknown throttling condition in the event that the actual throttling condition cannot be determined.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.ThrottlingMode
member.summary: Gets the value that reflects the throttling mode in SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.ThrottledResources
member.summary: Gets a list of the resources in the SQL Database that were subject to throttling conditions.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnDataSpace
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether physical data file space throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnLogSpace
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether physical log space throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnLogWrite
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether transaction activity throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnDataRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether data read activity throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnCpu
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether CPU throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnDatabaseSize
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether database size throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnWorkerThreads
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether concurrent requests throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.IsUnknown
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether throttling conditions were not determined with certainty.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.FromException(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException)
member.summary: Determines throttling conditions from the specified SQL exception.
member.param: The object that contains information relevant to an error returned by SQL Server when throttling conditions were encountered.
member.returns: An instance of the object that holds the decoded reason codes returned from SQL Database when throttling conditions were encountered.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.FromError(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlError)
member.summary: Determines the throttling conditions from the specified SQL error.
member.param: The object that contains information relevant to a warning or error returned by SQL Server.
member.returns: An instance of the object that holds the decoded reason codes returned from SQL Database when throttling conditions were encountered.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.FromReasonCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines the throttling conditions from the specified reason code.
member.param: The reason code returned by SQL Database that contains the throttling mode and the exceeded resource types.
member.returns: An instance of the object holding the decoded reason codes returned from SQL Database when encountering throttling conditions.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ThrottlingCondition.ToString
member.summary: Returns a textual representation of the current ThrottlingCondition object, including the information held with respect to throttled resources.
member.returns: A string that represents the current ThrottlingCondition object.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.CustomSqlPolicyRetryerOptions
member.summary: Defines the configuration options for a SqlServer retry strategy with explicitly specified retry intervals.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.CustomSqlPolicyRetryerOptions.CustomRetryIntervals
member.summary: An explicit list of intervals at which to attempt subsequent retries, and after which to propogate the underlying exception.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.CustomSqlPolicyRetryerOptions.CustomErrorCodes
member.summary: An optional list of numbers that identify a that indicates a transient error.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ExponentialRetryOptions.MaxAttempts
member.summary: The maximum number of retry attempts.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ExponentialRetryOptions.MinBackoff
member.summary: The minimum backoff time.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ExponentialRetryOptions.MaxBackoff
member.summary: The maximum backoff time.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.ExponentialRetryOptions.DeltaBackoff
member.summary: The value that will be used to calculate a random delta in the exponential delay between retries.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlPolicyRetryerOptions
member.summary: Defines the configuration options for a SqlServer retry strategy.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlPolicyRetryerOptions.ExponentialRetry
member.summary: The parameters to the exponential retry function.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlPolicyRetryerOptions.CustomErrorCodes
member.summary: An optional list of numbers that identify a that indicates a transient error.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Framework.TransientFaultHandling.Sql.SqlRetryHelper
member.summary: Defines default implementations for applying a to SQL-bound work for a given reference for a
